page.title: 16EDUCATION, HEMEL HEMPSTEAD
page.content: {Primary schools}in the area are a mixture of separate junior and infant and JMI (Junior Mixed Infant) schools. There are one or two{nursery schools and several voluntary{play groups.}In the newer areas the schools are mainly "open-plan", with increasing numbers. Many of the more "traditional" schools are in districts with falling rolls. In Adeyfield 2 junior schools have just amalgamated.{Secondary provision consists of large mixed comprehensive schools; one in each neighbourhood, with a wide degree of parental choice. Herts County Council published a Review of Secondary Education in December 1984, showing a decline in pupil numbers and asking for proposals for voluntary amalgamation of schools. Dacorum College provides{further {education}and{evening classes}for the district.
